intro: Agrostophyllum uniflorum, commonly known as the single-flowered grass-leaf plant, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, clustered flowers. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories or along stream banks. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette, and its inflorescence consists of numerous small, white to pale yellow flowers. Agrostophyllum uniflorum is valued in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and conservation efforts in its native habitats.
